inlineContent.text: The type of data the unit of work will produce if it succeeds.
All units of work have the potential of throwing an error, because they can all be canceled

abstract.text: Represents an asynchronous unit of work.
Delays the emission of output from the upstream
by a specified duration using a given clock.
Retries the upstream
up to a specified number of times while applying a transformation on error.
Shares data from the given cache based on a specified caching strategy and hashable keys.
Transforms a specific error produced by the asynchronous unit of work.
Represents an asynchronous unit of work.
Assigns the output of an asynchronous unit of work to a key path on an object.
Logs events from the upstream
to the console.
Replaces any errors from the upstream
with the provided value.
Shares data from the given cache based on a specified caching strategy and hashable keys.
Shares data from the given cache based on a specified caching strategy and hashable keys.
Shares data from the given cache based on a specified caching strategy and hashable keys.
Transforms the successful output of the upstream
using a provided key path.
Executes the task with an optional task executor and priority.
Catches a specific type of error emitted by the upstream
and handles them using the provided closure.
A unit of work that performs type erasure by wrapping another unit of work.
Tries to catch a specific type of error emitted by the upstream
and handles them using the provided throwing closure.
Executes the task with an optional task priority.
The result of the operation (will execute the task)
Introduces a breakpoint into the asynchronous unit of work.
Shares the upstream
among multiple downstream subscribers.
Adds a behavior to the unit of work that asserts no failures are emitted.
Transforms a
value emitted by the current
into its underlying success or failure.
Zips the result of the current unit of work with two other asynchronous units of work.
Executes the current asynchronous unit of work and returns an AnyCancellable token to cancel the subscription
Shares data from the given cache based on a specified caching strategy and hashable keys.
Shares data from the given cache based on a specified caching strategy and additional context information.
A channel that emits a single value or an error.
Cancel the task, even if it hasn’t begun yet.
Shares data from the given cache based on a specified caching strategy and hashable keys.
Decodes the output from the upstream
using the specified top-level decoder.
Executes the task with an optional task executor and priority and waits for the result.
Delays the emission of output from the upstream
by a specified duration using a given clock.
Retries the upstream
up to a specified number of times only when a specific error occurs.
Executes the task with an optional task priority and waits for the result.
Replaces any
values from the upstream
with the provided non-nil value.
Shares data from the given cache based on a specified caching strategy and hashable keys.
Transforms the successful output of the upstream
using a provided closure that can throw errors.
Transforms the successful output of the upstream
using a provided closure.
Tries to catch any errors emitted by the upstream
and handles them using the provided throwing closure.

up to a specified number of times.

Zips the result of the current unit of work with three other units of work and applies a transform function.
Zips the result of the current unit of work with another and applies a transform function.
Provides an unretained, safe to use (i.e. not implicitly unwrapped), reference to an object along with the events emitted by the operator.
In the case the provided object cannot be retained successfully, the sequence will throw.
Zips the result of the current unit of work with another asynchronous unit of work.
Retries the upstream
up to a specified number of times only when a specific error occurs, while applying a transformation on error.
Adds a timeout to the current asynchronous unit of work.
The type of data the unit of work will produce if it succeeds.
Adds a timeout to the current asynchronous unit of work.
Adds side-effects to the receiving events of the upstream
Shares data from the given cache based on a specified caching strategy and hashable keys.
Discards the output values from the upstream

using the provided asynchronous transformation closure.

Unwraps the optional value if present, or throws an error.

up to a specified number of times only when a specific error occurs, while applying a transformation on error.
